news_header: India's Mahakumbh Mela, the world's largest religious gathering, is underway with millions expected to attend, while South Korea faces political turmoil with impeachment votes.
news_text: On the second day of India's Mahakumbh Mela, the largest religious gathering globally, 400 million visitors are anticipated over six weeks. Pilgrims are participating in cleansing rituals. In South Korea, political unrest is escalating as lawmakers voted to impeach acting president Han Duck-soo, with Yoon Suk Yeol facing calls to resign amid failed martial law attempts. Meanwhile, a woman lifted 45kg at a contest for the elderly, and a plane crash at Muan Airport involved 181 passengers. In other news, new volcanic eruptions on Flores Island have caused panic, and three astronauts returned to China after their mission.
